questionStem.castext:
Enter \[ @ta@ \] #ans# ans1

This is a simple true/false dropdown. The "Not answered" option is important in multi-part questions where a student might like to go back and only answer another part.

Enter \[ @ta@ \] #ans# ans1

In this matrix type question the system creates a grid into which the student types in their answers. STACK automatically determines the size of this grid from the teacher's answer.

Note, if the point of the question is for students to determine the size of the matrix for themselves then you might prefer to consider using either the algebraic input, possibly with a "syntax hint" or the DragMath editor.

Matrices can also be added to displayed equations.

Enter \[ @ta@ = #ans2# \] ans22

Choose \[ @ta@ = #ans# \] ans1

This question demostrates an algebraic input box inside a displayed equation.

Type in the algebraic expression \[ @ta@ \] #ans# ans1

The algebraic input box is the default input option. It can be used for all other kinds, for example

  • Sets {1,2,3}
  • List [1,2,3]
  • Martices matrix([1,2],[3,4])
